pageContext.claim: “The failing @nytimes wrote a Fake piece today implying that because White House Counsel Don McGahn was giving hours of testimony to the Special Counsel, he must be a John Dean type “RAT.” But I allowed him and all others to testify - I didn’t have to.”
pageContext.analysis: Rather than failing, The Times has seen spikes in audience and subscribers. Plus, it is unusual for an attorney to provide that much testimony about a client. While McGahn did testify voluntarily, Trump could not evoke executive privilege to stop him. The Supreme Court {ruled} privilege can only be used in a criminal investigation if it relates to military or diplomatic matters.
